name: Clarion Collection Hotel Arlington Court Suites

reviews.text: Was booked into this hotel as part of a group of 24 who were attending a workshop in Washington D.C.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay - Value for Money

likes.liked: — Spacious room, good breakfast and dinners
likes.disliked: — Dinners should be serviced Monday through Friday.

reviews.text: Check-in quick. Loaded bags onto luggage trolley, wheeled it into the elevator and trundled it to the room. Not a problem whether you travel light or heavy.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Great room - very clean and lots of amenities
likes.disliked: — Steep uphill climb to the Metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - King Suite complete with a well-equipped kitchen. View from window - front of the hotel and the highway. Bed was oh so comfortable. My senior citizen mother who travelled with me and stayed on the premises during the day while I was attending the workshop enjoyed her rest. The grocery store is just a short walk away. Complimentary Toileteries were of good quality. Room was cleaned and towels changed daily.
reviews.title: Felt like a second home!

reviews.text: Food - Complimentary American Breakfast each morning (though items were repeated every other day) and also Dinner on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. Cookies/Dessert on Thursdays.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transport - Complimentary Bus Shuttle service to the metro station (CourtHouse) and nearby shopping malls. They will even pick you up, after you finish your shoppping! Good service.
reviews.title: Fabulous

likes.disliked: — Internet service - wish they had wired

reviews.text: Stayed two nights at this hotel with an average nightly rate of $142 (w/ my AAA membership). I was impressed (and surprised) by the great value the hotel delivers at that price: clean and spacious studio with a balcony, comfortable bed, free wifi, free hot breakfast on the 8th floor (w/ a view), free light dinner buffet Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and cookies on Thursday (how many hotels offer that?!), larger-than-usual exercise room, 5-min walk to Metro... Being a frequent traveler to the DC/Arlington area, I just wish I had discovered this hotel earlier. Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Best value in the Arlington area

reviews.text: Stayed for 9 days.
reviews.title: They are on the verge of really bad reviews

reviews.text: This is a renovated "mess" of a hotel with a 40 year-old elevator that when completely full does not stop even with the floor.
reviews.title: The Best!
good hotel and location
reviews.text: Wireless internet access - oh yes they have it. It registered at a measly speed of 156K after 6:00 pm.

Inclusive breakfast - oh yes they have that too. If you call water eggs, b&##**# wait staff and uneatable sausage links with dry pancakes and cold table syrup. Yes they keep the syrup out on the table at less than room temperature. A customer asked one of the staff members why they did this, she just shrugged.
reviews.title: Great deal - room- and locaiton

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a three day conference and this hotel was full of great surprises. Compared to other nearby hotels the price was great. I used my AAA discount so prices were comparable to other hotels. The room was nice, clean and roomy with a full kitchen..meaning a real refrigerator. Best thing.....FREE INTERNET FOLKS! This is especially important when you are on a business trip and you don't want to leave your room to go to a business center to work.
reviews.title: Sweet Surprise!

reviews.text: Another surprise, Monday to Friday there is a complimentary breakfast BUFFET 6am-9:30am and Monday to Wednesday 5:30pm-7:00pm there is a complimentary light dinner buffet. We took advantage of both and decided to eat out one night, but look at the money you'll save.
reviews.title: Our accommodations far exceeded our expectations and the service was awesome!!!

reviews.text: Hotel is close to local shops and restaurants and hop, skip and a jump to D.C.
reviews.title: Great Accommodations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do wish they had free parking. Its like $14 or so a day, which not bad. Also they need to work on the professionalism of their front staff.
reviews.title: This hotel was a find

reviews.text: Overall, great stay.
reviews.title: Homey, old fashioned and just plain nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only for a night however, we would of stayed longer, but Holiday Inn Rosslyn wouldn't let us out of our contract. Rooms were up to date, clean, roomy and we has a great view. There is a good selection of nearby restaurants that you can walk to. Didn't mind the hill most others referenced, more of a slight incline really.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price.

reviews.text: This hotel is great! We stayed 5 nights. At first, we considered some slightly cheaper hotels. But then decided to go with this one since it had a kitchen and we could make our own lunches before travelling into DC each day. I'm glad we did! Without even telling us at check-in, they upgraded us to a corner suite that had two bedrooms (each with King size bed), 2 bathrooms (1 1/2), a living room, dining room and full kitchen. My kids, wife and I were thrilled. We could see the Washington Monument from our window.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience ever!

reviews.text: The full breakfast buffet was amazing. Eggs, bacon or sausage, cooked potatos, oatmeal, grits, cereal, fruit, juices... all served on real china and glass glasses. And located on the top floor with a view of DC. Buffet room also had a pool table. Then to our surprise, they told us that they also provided a free dinner buffet on Mon, Tue and Wed. WOW. We woke up, went to breakfast, then went to DC for the day, then came back and had dinner. Perfect!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was also great. It was easy to walk to the metro. And if the hotel's shuttle bus happened to be there when we walked out, they were happy to drop us off at the metro. And it doesn't take long to get from the "Court House" metro station into DC. So the closeness to DC saved us a lot of travel time, had we stayed further out.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and value!!

reviews.text: The service was also great. The maid service even put our dishes in the dishwasher and started it.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
